  • Method Details

    • register

      @PostMapping("/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> register(@RequestBody RegisterRequest request)
      The register function is used to start the process to register a new user.
      Returns:
      A responseentity 200 if registration is successful 401 if mail is already present and tea_pot for other registration trouble;

    • authenticate

      @PostMapping("/authenticate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> authenticate(@RequestBody AuthenticationRequest request)
      The authenticate function takes in an AuthenticationRequest object, which contains a user's email and password. It then checks to see if the email and password are not empty strings. If they are not, it calls the authenticate function from the UserService class with that request as its parameter. This returns an AuthenticationResponse object containing a JWT token for that user (if their credentials were correct). The function then returns this response as part of a ResponseEntity with status code 200 (OK) if everything went well or 418 (I'm A Teapot) otherwise.
      Returns:
      A token that is used to access the other endpoints

    • homePage

      @PostMapping("/home-page") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> homePage(@RequestBody AuthenticationRequest request)
      The homePage function is a POST request that takes in an AuthenticationRequest object and returns an AuthenticationResponse object. The function calls the homePage method from the service class, which checks if the user exists in our database. If they do, it will return their username and password as well as a message saying "Welcome back!" If not, it will return null for both fields along with a message saying "You are not registered."
      Returns:
      An object of type authenticationresponse

    • refreshToken

      @GetMapping("/refresh-token") public void refreshToken(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException
      The refreshToken function is responsible for refreshing the JWT token.
      Parameters:
      HttpServletRequest - request Get the authorization header from the request
      HttpServletResponse - response Send the response back to the client
      Throws:
      IOException

    • ok

      @GetMapping("/cihairagionete") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> ok()

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/delete_user") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthenticationResponse> deleteUser(@RequestBody AuthenticationRequest request)
      The deleteUser function takes in a request body of type AuthenticationRequest, which contains the username and password of the user to be deleted. The function then calls on the deleteUser method from UserService, which returns an object of type AuthenticationResponse. This response is returned as part of a ResponseEntity with status code 200 if successful, or 404 if no such user exists. If any other exception occurs during this process (such as an internal server error), then a 500 INTERNAL SERVER ERROR is returned instead.
      Returns:
      An authenticationresponse object
